segments.text: what seems to be the problem ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: my computer just crashed again for the third time today !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what were you doing when it crashed ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: i was just opening up an attachment in an email about winning the lottery .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that might have been a virus .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , no ! I thought it seemed a bit strange .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what kind of computer do you have , a Mac or a PC ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it's a PC . doesn't everyone have a PC in this office ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , some people have Macs now , too .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: PCs often crash from virus , but it's nearly impossible to get a virus from a Mac .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: has your computer turned back on yet ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: did you end up losing any of your work ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: fortunately , I saved my work right before it crashed , so it should be OK .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: you should probably call the IT department and have them check your computer for virus .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's a good idea . I'll call them now . Thanks for your help !
segments.speaker: S1
